questions: Janet pays $40/hour for 3 hours per week of clarinet lessons and $28/hour for 5 hours a week of piano lessons. How much more does she spend on piano lessons than clarinet lessons in a year?
response:
First, calculate the weekly cost for each type of lesson:

Clarinet lessons: $40/hour \times 3 \text{ hours/week} = $120/week

Piano lessons: $28/hour \times 5 \text{ hours/week} = $140/week

Next, calculate the annual cost for each type of lesson:

Clarinet lessons: $120/week \times 52 \text{ weeks/year} = $6240/year

Piano lessons: $140/week \times 52 \text{ weeks/year} = $7280/year

Finally, to find out how much more she spends on piano lessons than clarinet lessons in a year, subtract the annual cost of clarinet lessons from the annual cost of piano lessons:

$7280/year (piano) - $6240/year (clarinet) = $1040/year

Janet spends $1040 more on piano lessons than clarinet lessons in a year.
